sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A ship carrying grain leaves the Ukrainian port of Odessa for the first time since the start of the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kosovo's government postpones its number plate plan after protests from Serbs living in the north.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And amid a heat wave, France limits the number of climbers allowed on Mont Blanc amid concerns of dangerous conditions. The first ship carrying Ukrainian grain has set off from the port of Odessa,

sentences.sentence: The Sierra Leone-flagged cargo ship Razony is expected to reach Istanbul tomorrow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's carrying 26,000 tonnes of grain, which has been stranded in Ukraine by the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Razony's progress was followed using its tracking system as it pulled out of Odessa alongside a tugboat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The ship's cargo will be inspected in Turkey before the Razony can proceed to its destination, Lebanon.

sentences.sentence: Ukraine's government said the ship's departure, brokered after international talks, was a step towards preventing world hunger, a risk that was intensified by the blockade of its ports by Russia. sentences.sentence: Russia's defense ministry claimed Sunday that its forces had eliminated up to 100 nationalists and 25 pieces of military equipment in Kherson and Mykolaiv regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Russian pounding of Ukraine's eastern town of Bakhmut was captured on camera. Bakhmut, which is one of the few remaining cities under Ukrainian control in the frontline Donetsk region, is now at the center of Russia's offensive in the east of the country.

sentences.sentence: At border crossings between Serbia and Kosovo, traffic jams and tension.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ethnic Serbs living in the north of Kosovo had organised road protests to show their anger at plans that would require them to replace Serbian number plates with new ones issued by the Kosovo government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Kosovo's police said they had no alternative but to close the border crossings in response.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Kosovo's government has accused neighbouring Serbia of trying to destabilise the country and says shots were fired in the direction of police patrols.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's postponed implementation of the vehicle license plate changes until September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Kosovo was part of Serbia until an armed uprising in 1998-99 by the area's ethnic Albanian majority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A NATO bombing campaign forced Serbia's troops out of the country, but Serbia refuses to recognize Kosovo's 2008 declaration of independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: to recognize Kosovo's 2008 Declaration of Independence. In the small town of North Mitrovica, air raid sirens were heard for more than three hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A NATO mission to Kosovo has more than 3,000 troops on the ground, while the European Union Union has been sponsoring talks between the two countries since 2013.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A senior Putin official who quit his position and left Russia in protest at the war in Ukraine has been rushed to intensive care after suddenly suffering acute numbness in his arms and legs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Specialists in hazmat suits examined the room where 67-year-old Anatoly Chubais was taken ill in an unspecified country in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Medical tests are continuing in the light of repeated cases where Putin's enemies have been poisoned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At the base of the Polish city of Poznania, where soldiers from the US Army are stationed, the compound has been renamed Camp Kosciuszko.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In honor of Thaddeus Kosciuszko, a national hero in Poland, known for leading troops in battle against the Russians, and also coming to the aid of the US in 1776 when he joined the war effort against the British.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We have just witnessed a very important event, therefore it's a symbolic event. It shows very strong, very close relations between Poland and the United States. These relations are very deeply rooted in the history of both our countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.sentence: The renaming comes as Russia's war in Ukraine rages on and Poland becomes an increasingly valuable NATO member.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Nichols broke barriers for black women in Hollywood by playing communications officer Lieutenant Nuhura on the Star Trek television series.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The actress was later employed in NASA's recruitment drive to encourage more women and African Americans to become astronauts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As France centres its third heatwave of the summer, mountain guides in the alpine region of Chamonix are limiting scheduled climbs of Mont Blanc, the highest point in the Alps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They feel access to the 4,800-metre summit is becoming too dangerous because of repeated rockfalls linked to a drought caused by extreme climate conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A lack of snow during the winter has also left vast stretches of bare grey glaciers criss-crossed with crevices, making already dangerous routes up the mountainside even narrower and more treacherous.

sentences.sentence: They cancelled the trip to Mont Blanc because of the weather and I think the guides know the area and they know the conditions so that's fine for us. We can do it somewhere of the year. time for us. We can do it somewhere. It's not just the Alps that are warming up. Last month a 200 meter long crack appeared on the Marmolada glacier in Italy's Dolomites. Two weeks earlier a deadly avalanche of ice and debris there killed at least 11 people when a huge chunk of the glacier broke loose. Experts say warming temperatures are to blame.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: An apocalyptic wildfire in California is still uncontained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of firefighters are battling the largest fire to spread in the state so far this year. The blaze has forced over 2,000 residents to evacuate their homes over the weekend. It has now spread to cover more than 200 square kilometres. Encouraged by hot and windy conditions, the fire has torched trees along the California Highway 96, and experts have issued a red flag warning, indicating the threat of dangerous fire conditions.
